{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Manager",
  "description": "ALIMA is an international medical humanitarian organization founded in 2009. We provide quality healthcare to the most vulnerable populations in emergency situations across sub-Saharan Africa. ALIMA operates through partnerships with local NGOs and emphasizes proximity, innovation, and collaboration.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Supervision: Reports directly to the HR Coordinator
Line Management: Supervises HR Assistants
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	The Human Resources Manager (HR Manager) will oversee HR operations for the Nigeria Mission Coordination Office and support HR processes across all ALIMA projects in the country.
	Reporting to the Human Resources Coordinator (HRCo), the HR Manager will ensure effective implementation of ALIMA&rsquo;s HR policies, compliance with Nigerian labour laws, and alignment with ALIMA&rsquo;s mission strategy.
	Mission Location: Abuja, Nigeria (with visits to field projects in Borno, Yobe, Katsina, Ondo, and other future sites)


Main Responsibilities
Human Resources Management:


	Ensure technical and administrative management of HR operations in line with ALIMA&rsquo;s HR policies and Nigeria Mission regulations.
	Implement the HR component of the Mission Strategic Plan.
	Ensure compliance of staff contracts with ALIMA standards and Nigerian labour laws.
	Support the HRCo in reviewing and updating the Mission&rsquo;s Internal Regulations annually.
	Identify HR challenges and propose solutions, including policy development.
	Participate in disciplinary procedures, ensuring legal compliance and proper documentation.


Recruitment, Onboarding, and Offboarding:


	Lead recruitment, selection, induction, appraisal, and exit processes for national staff.
	Ensure all staff have valid contracts, job descriptions, and updated personnel files.
	Coordinate expatriate staff onboarding and offboarding processes.
	Guarantee timely and compliant payment of salaries, taxes, pensions, and social security contributions.


Staff Development and Performance Management:


	Supervise and mentor HR staff.
	Ensure annual HR development and training plans are implemented and updated quarterly.
	Oversee performance appraisal processes and ensure follow-up actions.
	Support career development and staff well-being initiatives.


Payroll and Compliance:


	Manage and update payroll systems (ODOO), ensuring accuracy and completeness.
	Verify and consolidate payroll submissions from bases.
	Ensure timely remittance of PAYE tax, pension, NHF, and social security contributions.
	Prepare annual tax statements for staff and ensure compliance with audit requirements.


Staff Safety, Health, and Working Environment:


	Ensure compliance with occupational health and safety policies.
	Monitor working conditions, hygiene, and staff well-being across projects.


HR Administration and Record Keeping:


	Maintain systematic HR databases and filing systems, including staff lists, leave registers, and Homere updates.
	Ensure accurate monitoring and documentation of staff absences.


Reporting and Communication:


	Compile and validate HR reports from projects before submission to the HR Coordinator.
	Contribute to the monthly HR SitRep.
	Support HR-related audits in collaboration with Finance.
	Ensure effective communication with staff on HR policies and issues.


PSEA, Protection, and Compliance:


	Promote awareness and adherence to ALIMA&rsquo;s PSEA (Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse) Policy, Code of Conduct, and Safeguarding standards.
	Ensure staff, partners, and community members are trained on reporting mechanisms and the prevention of abuse of power and sexual violence.
	Support investigations and corrective measures in line with ALIMA&rsquo;s zero-tolerance policy.
	Create and maintain a safe, respectful, and protective working environment for staff and partners.


Qualifications and Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Professional HR certification required; a Master&rsquo;s degree is an advantage.


Experience:


	At least 4 years of professional HR management experience with an International NGO.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labour laws, tax regulations, and HR frameworks.
	Proven experience in payroll management, recruitment, and staff development.


Skills and Competencies (Required):


	Professional fluency in English (oral and written).
	Strong organisational and analytical skills; detail-oriented.
	Ability to work independently and under pressure.
	Strong interpersonal, counselling, and negotiation skills.
	Proven ability to lead and manage HR teams.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience with ODOO HR systems.
	Familiarity with Hausa or Kanuri languages is an asset.
	Commitment to ALIMA&rsquo;s values and Charter.


Contract Terms


	Salary: As per the ALIMA salary grid
	Type: National contract, under Nigerian labour law
	Duration: 6 months (renewable)


Note


	Only applications submitted through the form will be considered.
	Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, and ALIMA reserves the right to close recruitment before the deadline if a suitable candidate is identified.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	Female candidates are strongly encouraged to apply.
	ALIMA will never request payment or favours during the recruitment process.
	Any form of sexual exploitation, abuse, or harassment is strictly prohibited and will not be tolerated.
	Reference checks and background screening will be conducted for selected candidates.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-15",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-27",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Alliance for International Medical Action"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "188888"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Human Resources Manager Job at Alliance for International Medical Action (ALIMA)




        
    

        
        ALIMA is an international medical humanitarian organization founded in 2009. We provide quality healthcare to the most vulnerable populations in emergency situations across sub-Saharan Africa. ALIMA operates through partnerships with local NGOs and emphasizes proximity, innovation, and collaboration.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Manager
Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Supervision: Reports directly to the HR Coordinator
Line Management: Supervises HR Assistants
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview
     

            
    




	The Human Resources Manager (HR Manager) will oversee HR operations for the Nigeria Mission Coordination Office and support HR processes across all ALIMA projects in the country.
	Reporting to the Human Resources Coordinator (HRCo), the HR Manager will ensure effective implementation of ALIMA’s HR policies, compliance with Nigerian labour laws, and alignment with ALIMA’s mission strategy.
	Mission Location: Abuja, Nigeria (with visits to field projects in Borno, Yobe, Katsina, Ondo, and other future sites)


Main Responsibilities
Human Resources Management:


	Ensure technical and administrative management of HR operations in line with ALIMA’s HR policies and Nigeria Mission regulations.
	Implement the HR component of the Mission Strategic Plan.
	Ensure compliance of staff contracts with ALIMA standards and Nigerian labour laws.
	Support the HRCo in reviewing and updating the Mission’s Internal Regulations annually.
	Identify HR challenges and propose solutions, including policy development.
	Participate in disciplinary procedures, ensuring legal compliance and proper documentation.


Recruitment, Onboarding, and Offboarding:


	Lead recruitment, selection, induction, appraisal, and exit processes for national staff.
	Ensure all staff have valid contracts, job descriptions, and updated personnel files.
	Coordinate expatriate staff onboarding and offboarding processes.
	Guarantee timely and compliant payment of salaries, taxes, pensions, and social security contributions.


Staff Development and Performance Management:


	Supervise and mentor HR staff.
	Ensure annual HR development and training plans are implemented and updated quarterly.
	Oversee performance appraisal processes and ensure follow-up actions.
	Support career development and staff well-being initiatives.


Payroll and Compliance:


	Manage and update payroll systems (ODOO), ensuring accuracy and completeness.
	Verify and consolidate payroll submissions from bases.
	Ensure timely remittance of PAYE tax, pension, NHF, and social security contributions.
	Prepare annual tax statements for staff and ensure compliance with audit requirements.


Staff Safety, Health, and Working Environment:


	Ensure compliance with occupational health and safety policies.
	Monitor working conditions, hygiene, and staff well-being across projects.


HR Administration and Record Keeping:


	Maintain systematic HR databases and filing systems, including staff lists, leave registers, and Homere updates.
	Ensure accurate monitoring and documentation of staff absences.


Reporting and Communication:


	Compile and validate HR reports from projects before submission to the HR Coordinator.
	Contribute to the monthly HR SitRep.
	Support HR-related audits in collaboration with Finance.
	Ensure effective communication with staff on HR policies and issues.


PSEA, Protection, and Compliance:


	Promote awareness and adherence to ALIMA’s PSEA (Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse) Policy, Code of Conduct, and Safeguarding standards.
	Ensure staff, partners, and community members are trained on reporting mechanisms and the prevention of abuse of power and sexual violence.
	Support investigations and corrective measures in line with ALIMA’s zero-tolerance policy.
	Create and maintain a safe, respectful, and protective working environment for staff and partners.


Qualifications and Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Professional HR certification required; a Master’s degree is an advantage.


Experience:


	At least 4 years of professional HR management experience with an International NGO.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labour laws, tax regulations, and HR frameworks.
	Proven experience in payroll management, recruitment, and staff development.


Skills and Competencies (Required):


	Professional fluency in English (oral and written).
	Strong organisational and analytical skills; detail-oriented.
	Ability to work independently and under pressure.
	Strong interpersonal, counselling, and negotiation skills.
	Proven ability to lead and manage HR teams.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience with ODOO HR systems.
	Familiarity with Hausa or Kanuri languages is an asset.
	Commitment to ALIMA’s values and Charter.


Contract Terms


	Salary: As per the ALIMA salary grid
	Type: National contract, under Nigerian labour law
	Duration: 6 months (renewable)


Note


	Only applications submitted through the form will be considered.
	Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, and ALIMA reserves the right to close recruitment before the deadline if a suitable candidate is identified.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	Female candidates are strongly encouraged to apply.
	ALIMA will never request payment or favours during the recruitment process.
	Any form of sexual exploitation, abuse, or harassment is strictly prohibited and will not be tolerated.
	Reference checks and background screening will be conducted for selected candidates.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Business Analyst Job at QuPee Consult




        
    

        
        QuPee Consult is an indigenous company that is into Admin, Consulting and HR services. We help our clients get the best human resources for their various available positions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Analyst
Job Location: VI, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Candidate must be a graduate
	Data Analyst should not apply
	Must be experienced and well behaved.


Salary
N400,000 per month. 
     

            
    



Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: onyi.alums@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Auditor",
  "description": "Oxen Hr Limited was registered in 2021 with the Care Quality Commission (CQC) to provide Personal Care to both younger and older adults. We care for people with dementia, mental health conditions, and physical disabilities. Our vision is to provide people with high-quality person-centred care. Thus, we have robust and effective strategies to deliver high-quality care that is personalized to meet the individual needs and preferences of our service users in a safe, caring, effective and responsive environment by a well-led workforce with the skills, knowledge, and resources to meet the highest possible standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Auditor

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking an attentive and analytical Auditor to contribute to this growing Audit team within the practice.
	This role requires a keen eye for detail and a commitment to ensuring all financial records are accurate and within compliance.


Responsibilities (Not limited to)


	Conducting routine audits and identifying any financial irregularities.
	Ensuring all financial records are in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
	Preparing detailed reports on audit findings and making recommendations for improvements.
	Assisting in the development of an annual audit plan.
	Providing support to the finance team in the preparation of financial statements.
	Collaborating with team members to carry out tasks and projects efficiently.


Requirements
A successful Auditor should have:


	A Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Any of the following qualification ACA/ACCA/AAT
	Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Ability to work collaboratively within a team.
	Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and exercising discretion.


Benefits


	An estimated salary range of N250,000 - N400,000 per month.
	Flexible and hybrid working arrangements to promote work-life balance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Applications to:&nbsp;recruitment@oxenhr.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Auditor Job at Oxen Hr Limited




        
    

        
        Oxen Hr Limited was registered in 2021 with the Care Quality Commission (CQC) to provide Personal Care to both younger and older adults. We care for people with dementia, mental health conditions, and physical disabilities. Our vision is to provide people with high-quality person-centred care. Thus, we have robust and effective strategies to deliver high-quality care that is personalized to meet the individual needs and preferences of our service users in a safe, caring, effective and responsive environment by a well-led workforce with the skills, knowledge, and resources to meet the highest possible standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Auditor
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking an attentive and analytical Auditor to contribute to this growing Audit team within the practice.
	This role requires a keen eye for detail and a commitment to ensuring all financial records are accurate and within compliance.


Responsibilities (Not limited to)


	Conducting routine audits and identifying any financial irregularities.
	Ensuring all financial records are in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
	Preparing detailed reports on audit findings and making recommendations for improvements.
	Assisting in the development of an annual audit plan.
	Providing support to the finance team in the preparation of financial statements.
	Collaborating with team members to carry out tasks and projects efficiently.


Requirements
A successful Auditor should have:


	A Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Any of the following qualification ACA/ACCA/AAT
	Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Ability to work collaboratively within a team.
	Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and exercising discretion.


Benefits


	An estimated salary range of N250,000 - N400,000 per month.
	Flexible and hybrid working arrangements to promote work-life balance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Applications to: recruitment@oxenhr.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Compliance Officer",
  "description": "At Brit Properties, we specialize in providing innovative real estate solutions that meet the evolving needs of our clients. With a strong track record in property acquisitions, leasing, sales, and management, we are committed to delivering exceptional service and creating long-lasting relationships with both our clients and employees. Our team is driven by a passion for excellence and a dedication to providing tailored property solutions that enhance the value and potential of every project.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compliance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Ensure adherence to local labor laws, employment regulations, and statutory requirements (PF, ESI, gratuity, minimum wages, etc.)
	Monitor and implement regulatory changes affecting HR and workforce management
	Conduct regular audits of employee records, contracts, and statutory documentation
	Ensure contractor and subcontractor labor compliance at project/construction sites
	Coordinate with external auditors, labor consultants, and government agencies
	Draft, review, and update HR policies and ensure consistent implementation across departments and sites
	Train HR team members, managers, and site supervisors on compliance-related matters
	Prepare compliance reports for internal and external stakeholders


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resources, Law, Business Administration, or a related field (Master&rsquo;s or LLB preferred)
	2 &ndash; 3 years of experience in HR compliance, preferably in real estate, infrastructure, or manufacturing
	Strong knowledge of employment laws and labor regulations
	Experience handling labor compliance at project or construction sites is a strong advantage
	Excellent attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and high ethical standards
	Proficient in MS Office and HRMS/statutory compliance tools
	Candidate must reside in or around the Ajah axis.


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;Onedibe.kosisochukwu@britproperties.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.&nbsp;",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-20",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",

      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Compliance Officer Job at Brit Properties




        
    

        
        At Brit Properties, we specialize in providing innovative real estate solutions that meet the evolving needs of our clients. With a strong track record in property acquisitions, leasing, sales, and management, we are committed to delivering exceptional service and creating long-lasting relationships with both our clients and employees. Our team is driven by a passion for excellence and a dedication to providing tailored property solutions that enhance the value and potential of every project.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compliance Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Ensure adherence to local labor laws, employment regulations, and statutory requirements (PF, ESI, gratuity, minimum wages, etc.)
	Monitor and implement regulatory changes affecting HR and workforce management
	Conduct regular audits of employee records, contracts, and statutory documentation
	Ensure contractor and subcontractor labor compliance at project/construction sites
	Coordinate with external auditors, labor consultants, and government agencies
	Draft, review, and update HR policies and ensure consistent implementation across departments and sites
	Train HR team members, managers, and site supervisors on compliance-related matters
	Prepare compliance reports for internal and external stakeholders


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Law, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s or LLB preferred)
	2 – 3 years of experience in HR compliance, preferably in real estate, infrastructure, or manufacturing
	Strong knowledge of employment laws and labor regulations
	Experience handling labor compliance at project or construction sites is a strong advantage
	Excellent attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and high ethical standards
	Proficient in MS Office and HRMS/statutory compliance tools
	Candidate must reside in or around the Ajah axis.


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: Onedibe.kosisochukwu@britproperties.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.     

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

            
    




   


    
        Similar Jobs

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR Officer",
  "description": "Oceanic Health Management Limited isone of the largest Healthcare insurance providers in Nigeria offeringsecond to none optimum services in the healthcare industry. Our smart use of technology has enabled us offer excellent HMO services to our clients who are spread across multiple industries in Nigeria.

We are&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Duties/ Responsibilities/ Accountabilities


	Assisting in talent acquisition and recruitment processes.
	Conducting employee onboarding, offboarding and exit interviews accordingly.
	Providing support to employees in various HR-related topics such as leaves and compensation and resolving any issues that may arise.
	Preparing reports relating to personnel activities (staffing, recruitment, training, grievances, performance evaluations etc.)
	Maintaining employee files and records in electronic and paper forms.
	Regularly meeting with employees for progress reviews and assessments, discussing any problems or grievances they may have.
	Developing monthly payroll ensuring all updates are processed accurately and payment made on time.&nbsp;
	Ensuring compliance with labor regulations such as&nbsp;NSITF, payee, withholding tax, pension, ITF, Group life e.t.c.&nbsp;


Requirements


	Minimum of&nbsp;BSc / HND in Human Resources, Industrial relations or related courses.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Preferable with at least 2 to 3 years&rsquo; experience in HMO is essential.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications including outlook is required.&nbsp;
	Strong verbal and written communication skills are required&nbsp;
	Pleasant disposition with excellent interpersonal skills.&nbsp;


Salary
Negotiable.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should&nbsp;send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@oceanichealthng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

HR Officer Job at Oceanic Health Management Limited




        
    

        
        Oceanic Health Management Limited isone of the largest Healthcare insurance providers in Nigeria offeringsecond to none optimum services in the healthcare industry. Our smart use of technology has enabled us offer excellent HMO services to our clients who are spread across multiple industries in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Duties/ Responsibilities/ Accountabilities
     

            
    




	Assisting in talent acquisition and recruitment processes.
	Conducting employee onboarding, offboarding and exit interviews accordingly.
	Providing support to employees in various HR-related topics such as leaves and compensation and resolving any issues that may arise.
	Preparing reports relating to personnel activities (staffing, recruitment, training, grievances, performance evaluations etc.)
	Maintaining employee files and records in electronic and paper forms.
	Regularly meeting with employees for progress reviews and assessments, discussing any problems or grievances they may have.
	Developing monthly payroll ensuring all updates are processed accurately and payment made on time. 
	Ensuring compliance with labor regulations such as NSITF, payee, withholding tax, pension, ITF, Group life e.t.c. 


Requirements


	Minimum of BSc / HND in Human Resources, Industrial relations or related courses.  
	Preferable with at least 2 to 3 years’ experience in HMO is essential.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications including outlook is required. 
	Strong verbal and written communication skills are required 
	Pleasant disposition with excellent interpersonal skills. 


Salary
Negotiable.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@oceanichealthng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
